bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 2, 1896

div1.p: Lazear describes his cross-country trip. He discusses a proposed real estate deal.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 2, 1896
div1.p:
I left
Baltimore on
Monday evening. The
trip is rather
tiresome but I
think I am getting
used to it. We
have had a
variety of weather
very hot and very
cold. We are
due at Denver
tomorrow morning
and I shall mail
this there. I do
not expect to
sp stop on the
way. Now that
I am started
I prefer to go
right on. Travelling is
a horrible bore.

I met cousin Jess at Pittsburgh
He happened to be at the
station. He says the sale of
the Frankstown Ave property has
fallen through. He gave
no particular news
about the family.
